hi guys I'm Laura Vitale on this episode

favorite recipe
I call it salted caramel because I
always think it's really important to
add a pinch of really good quality sea
salt in order to really balance out the
sweetness of the caramel sauce and I
figured I'd share this with you because
you're going to see this being served

unsalted butter it's been softened a bit

sel and some vanilla extract that is it
comes together in less than 10 minutes
and it is fantastic
let's get started to my sauce pan I'm

want to mention that what I do when I
use brown sugar I always mean pact
otherwise it's like the weight will

now this caramel sauce is gonna be a

just keep in mind that the darker the

that looks perfect now keep in mind that
as you caramel cools it is going to
thicken so you don't want to add you
don't want to you know you know you
don't want to keep it cooking to thicken

going to thicken and that only actually
took about five minutes you just want to
make sure that you keep it like medium
low heat you don't want it to bubble up
so so so so much that it gets really
hard and really clumpy if that were to

thing to do is to just put it in a mason
jar and then any time I want to use it
because it does harden a bit and it gets
thicker and thicker and not pourable
when you put it in the fridge all you do
is take off the lid add literally a drop
or maybe a tablespoon or so of water pop
it in the microwave and then just going
to give it a stir every thirty seconds
or so or until it warms up and it
loosens up a bit and you have like
perfect caramel sauce on hand at all
times it's really a time-saver and I
